abstract: Changing priorities have left investment banks, hedge funds and even nonfinancial companies in a holding pattern about the compliance and costs of new regulation.
snippet: Changing priorities have left investment banks, hedge funds and even nonfinancial companies in a holding pattern about the compliance and costs of new regulation.
lead_paragraph: LONDON - As the Continent grapples with the sovereign debt crisis, financial regulatory revision in Europe has been put on the back burner, with some rules delayed until at least 2013.

headline.main: Europe's Debt Crisis Stymies Financial Overhaul
